alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Central and Southeast Park County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 31 at 12:45AM MDT until March 31 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...ANOTHER DAY OF CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS... Another round of strong and gusty winds, this time from the northwest. The airmass will remain quite dry in spite of cooler temperatures and the warning areas haven`t seen appreciable snowfall lately. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ALL OF THE DENVER METRO AREA, THE PLAINS OF BOULDER AND JEFFERSON COUNTIES, SOUTH PARK, AND THE PALMER DIVIDE AND ADJACENT PLAINS SOUTH AND EAST... FIRE WEATHER ZONES 214...239...240...241...246...AND 247... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 214, 239, 240, 241, 246 and 247. * Timing...Until 8 PM MDT this evening, and Noon to 7 PM MDT Friday * Winds...Northwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 10 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid fire spread. Avoid outdoor burning and any activities that may produce sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
